00078 class core_alloc_t {
00079 
00080   public:
00081 
00082   bool drain_in_progress;
00083 
00084   core_alloc_t(void);
00085   virtual ~core_alloc_t();
00086   virtual void reg_stats(struct stat_sdb_t * const sdb) = 0;
00087 
00088   virtual void step(void) = 0;
00089   virtual void recover(void) = 0;
00090   virtual void recover(const struct Mop_t * const Mop) = 0;
00091 
00092   /* interface functions back to the alloc stage
00093      RS_deallocate() notifies that an RS entry has been deallocated for the
00094         purposes of tracking execution port loading
00095      start_drain() causes allocation to stall until the back-end has
00096         been completely drained of wrong-path instructions
00097      */
00098   virtual void RS_deallocate(const struct uop_t * const uop) = 0;
00099   virtual void start_drain(void) = 0; /* prevent allocation from proceeding to exec */
00100 
00101   protected:
00102   struct core_t * core;
00103 };
00104 
00105 
00106 void alloc_reg_options(struct opt_odb_t * odb, struct core_knobs_t * knobs);
00107 class core_alloc_t * alloc_create(const char * alloc_opt_string, struct core_t * core);
